page.title: 01BRANT BROUGHTON AREA REVIEW
page.content: The area under review is mainly arable farmland with some cattle pasture.It contains most of the village of Brant Broughton and the Beckingham Military Training Camp.It lies at the foot of the Lincoln Edge,bordered by the River Witham to the west and the River Brant to the east. The village(pronounced Brant Brewton) is mentioned in the original Domesday Book as Burtune.It is about 12 miles from Lincoln, Grantham and Sleaford and 8 miles from Newark.It consists of High Street,bordered by several large houses, with West Street running parallel.These are joined by 5 lanes. Most houses are built of brick; the rest are all or partly of limestone. Recently some old people's bungalows, a few private houses and a new school have been built.One general stores closed last year leaving one remaining
